meanings.definition: A person or thing that subsists.
meanings.sent1: The subsisters in the village relied on the crops they grew.
meanings.sent2: The subsisters in the shelter received food donations regularly.
meanings.sent3: The subsisters at the picnic happily shared their snacks.
meanings.sent4: The subsisters of the ecosystem play a crucial role in its balance.
meanings.sent5: The subsisters in the desert adapted to survive with limited resources.

meanings.definition: Those who subsist or are maintained at the expense of another.
meanings.sent1: The subsisters in the orphanage were cared for by the staff.
meanings.sent2: The subsisters in the household depended on the breadwinner for support.
meanings.sent3: The subsisters at the party enjoyed the free drinks and snacks.
meanings.sent4: The subsisters of the family were grateful for the support during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The subsisters in the zoo thrived under the care of the keepers.
